• CEI 1974 Bible: Public Domain according to Biblegateway 
• Nova Vulgata Bible: Public Domain 
• Clementine Vulgata Bible: Public Domain 
• LXX Bible: Public Domain 
• Nestle 1904 Bible: Public Domain. Thanks to https://sites.google.com/site/nestle1904/luke 
• Catholic Public Domain Bible: Public Domain 
• WLC Bible: Public Domain 
• Italian and eglish introductions: Property of the Foundation of Religion Saints Francis of Assisi and Catherine of Siena 
• Italian footnotes: Property of the Foundation of Religion Saints Francis of Assisi and Catherine of Siena 
• English footnotes: Public Domain 
• Pray icon: Cristiano Zoucas from the Noun Project

The search is case-insensitive.
It is possible to search with the following criteria:
Single word: will be displayed al the chapters containing that word. The accents will be ignored by defaults, unless you select the related options in the filter menu. E.g.: Word\n\n
More words: we will load all chapters containing both words, not necessarily close to each other. Words with less than three characters are ignored. Example: Word flesh \n\n
One or more non-whole words: selecting the \"Whole Word\" option in the Filter menu, you\'ll search all words that begin with the words entered. Example: Wor fles\n\n
More words in quotes: we will search for the exact match of the words with their order, punctuation and any accents. Example: \"The Word became flesh\"\n\n

References: it is possible to search and view the readings indicating the initials of the book, chapter and verse. To separate the chapter number from the verses using the \",\" while to separate verses with each other using the \"..\" It is possible to specify a range using verses \"-.\" The various chapters or books can be separated with \";\" or a space Example: Mt21,15-19.24-26.29; 22,15.18-26; 1Cor 12.5-7

Choose the random chapter within a Testament
Do you really want to delete all the bookmarks?
Welcome to App Catholic Bible. This short guide will show you the basic functions.
You can add a bookmark on chapter by pressing the star, on the single verse by pressing the number or a range of verses.
From Home, you can read the Bible daily readings, a chapter at random, bookmarks and browsing history
By pressing on the lens, you can search the Bible individual words, phrases and references, such as Mt1,5
From the side menu you can access Settings, which allow you to configure the app in many aspects
This guide can be called up from the side menu

Dear Developer,

while appreciating the considerable commitment shown so far in the creation of this app, I wanted to alert you that I have encountered this problem:
Dear Developer,\n\nI really appreciate the considerable commitment shown so far in the creation of this app. I wanted to know how I can help or support you. Please write me back.
You can edit the color, the zoom, the alignement of text and choosea compact view

You can order by holding down on them and dragging them. You can delete them by scrolling on them from left to right
The graphics and content were reviewed by Dr. prof. Amerigo Muschi (MSc degree in Religious Sciences at the ISSR of Udine)
The application was designed and developed by Flavio Barisi (MSc degree in Electronic Engineering at the University of Trieste).
In order to use this Bible version, you have to install an Expansion Pack. Do you want to go on the Play Store to download it?
